See also: léise

German[edit]

Alternative forms[edit]

  • leis (colloquial or poetic)

Etymology[edit]

From Old High German līso.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈlaɪzə/
  • audio
    		(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɪ̯zə

Adjective[edit]

leise (comparative leiser, superlative am leisesten)

  1. quiet, soft, low
  2. slight, faint, light

Further reading[edit]

  • leise in Duden online

Antonyms[edit]

  • laut

Irish[edit]

Noun[edit]

leise f pl

  1. genitive singular of leis (“thigh; leg, haunch”)
